description: When the user is feeling thankful for blessings and wants to express gratitude to Allah with sincerity and awareness.

primary.text_en: If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.
primary.text_ar: لَئِن شَكَرْتُمْ لَأَزِيدَنَّكُمْ وَلَئِن كَفَرْتُمْ إِنَّ عَذَابِى لَشَدِيدٌ

primary.text_en: So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.
primary.text_ar: فَٱذْكُرُونِىٓ أَذْكُرْكُمْ وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ لِى وَلَا تَكْفُرُونِ
primary.explanation: Gratitude strengthens your bond with Allah.

primary.text_en: So eat of the lawful and good food which Allah has provided for you. And be grateful for the favor of Allah, if it is Him that you worship.
primary.text_ar: فَكُلُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ حَلَـٰلٗا طَيِّبٗا وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ إِيَّاهُ تَعْبُدُونَ
primary.explanation: Gratitude is part of true worship.

primary.text_en: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or ungrateful.
primary.text_ar: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرٗا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

primary.text_en: And We certainly gave Luqman wisdom [and said], 'Be grateful to Allah.' And whoever is grateful — it is for [the benefit of] himself.
primary.text_ar: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا لُقْمَـٰنَ ٱلْحِكْمَةَ أَنِ ٱشْكُرْ لِلَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَشْكُرْ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ

primary.text_en: The Prophet ﷺ would stand at night in prayer until his feet swelled. He was asked why, and he said: ‘Should I not be a grateful servant?’
Whoever is not grateful to people is not grateful to Allah.
primary.explanation: Gratitude is both vertical and horizontal — to Allah and people.

primary.text_en: Allah is pleased with His servant who eats something and praises Him or drinks something and praises Him.
primary.explanation: Even daily actions can express deep gratitude.

primary.text_en: The most beloved people to Allah are those most beneficial to others.
He who wakes up secure in his home, healthy in his body, with food for the day — it is as if the world has been gathered for him.
primary.explanation: Gratitude grows from recognizing daily blessings.

duas.text_en: O Allah, help me remember You, to thank You, and to worship You in the best way.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ أَعِنِّي عَلَىٰ ذِكْرِكَ، وَشُكْرِكَ، وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ
duas.explanation: A perfect daily dua for maintaining gratitude.

duas.text_en: All praise is due to Allah who gave us food and drink and made us among the Muslims.
duas.text_ar: ٱلْـحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْعَمَنَا وَسَقَانَا وَجَعَلَنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
duas.explanation: A beautiful reminder after meals — never take Islam for granted.

reflection: Gratitude is not just a feeling — it’s an act of remembrance, humility, and recognition of Allah’s mercy. The more we thank, the more we receive. Even hardship can be a blessing in disguise, steering us back to what matters. Start small — a breath, a bite, a moment — and let that thankfulness grow.
